Mac OSX system path not working

I was trying to add a new path to the systems path via both /etc/paths and .bash_profile but the terminal would not get it on echo $PATH.

The problem was that I am using a shell called Fish which means that you have to set the systems path another place.

Here is how I solved it

Create new fish config file: $ touch ~/.config/fish/config.fish

Open config file: $ nano ~/.config/fish/config.fish

Insert path to file: ยง echo set -gx PATH \$PATH

Then CTRL + X and yes to save, then restart terminal and you a good to go.

5:
Laravel Drop Unique Index

I was trying to drop an unique index via php artisan migrate but got an error which said I could not drop the column i was trying to remove the unique key from.

This is the failing code:

public function up()
{
    Schema::table('news', function (Blueprint $table) {
            $table->dropUnique('title');
        });
}

public function down()
{
    Schema::table('news', function (Blueprint $table) {
            $table->unique('title');
        });
}

`

The problem was I that dropUnique needs a full path/name for the index.

Working example:

public function up()
{
    Schema::table('news', function (Blueprint $table) {
            $table->dropUnique('news_title_unique');
        });
}

public function down()
{
    Schema::table('news', function (Blueprint $table) {
            $table->unique('title');
        });
}

So dropUnique get first the table "news" then the column "title" and then the unique key "unique" all in all "newstitleunique".

29:
All input not showing on submit

I got a bug on on of my web apps as newly created products where not being sent when I submitted the form.

Every input looked good in the form and I just many many many hours trying to debug this issue.

The problem was PHP has a default security setting that says PHP will not receive more than 1000 input fields. And i was sending about 1100 fields meaning that last 100 input fields would not show up. It just ignores the rest and will not send an error.

If you are using the Apache the fix is simple just add these lines to you .htaccess file. phpvalue maxinputvars 6000 phpvalue suhosin.post.maxvars 6000 phpvalue suhosin.request.max_vars 6000

And you are good to go.

On Nginx you need to edit the php.ini file, and uncomment the line with maxinputvars and set it to a higher number.

If you are not sure where the php.ini is located just use the phpinfo(); function.

There will be a row called "Loaded Configuration File" which will tell you the path to the php.ini file.

The path will be something like this /etc/php/7.0/php.ini.

So to edit you could use a line like as this.

nano /etc/php/7.0/php.ini

It will look like this: ; maxinputvars = 1000

I changed mine to this: maxinputvars = 4000

After this you have to restart php process manager with this command:

/etc/init.d/php7.0-fpm restart

Now it should work

90. Snappy Laravel 4.2 problem (wkhtmltopdf)

I had some problems with getting Snappy Laravel (wkhtmltopdf) to work in my homestead box. Here are the steps to get it working:

  1. sudo apt-get install wkhtmltopdf (this will be located at /usr/bin directory) # you can cd to the dir example: cd /usr/bin and see if they are installed there
  2. sudo chmod a+x /usr/bin/wkhtmltopdf
  3. sudo apt-get install openssl build-essential xorg libssl-dev
  4. sudo /usr/bin/wkhtmltopdf http://www.google.com test.pdf #Test if this works, in my machine it did not work and I had to do some more steps
  5. sudo apt-get install xvfb
  6. touch wkhtmltopdf.sh (this should be done in the /usr/bin/ folder)
  7. sudo nano wkhtmltopdf.sh
  8. add this line: xvfb-run wkhtmltopdf "$@"
  9. ctrl + o (to save)
  10. ctrl + x (to exit)
  11. wkhtmltopdf.sh http://www.google.com test.pdf (should create pdf file named test.pdf) # in my case I printed it out to /usr/test.pdf like this, because of permissions # wkhtmltopdf.sh http://www.google.com usr/test.pdf
  12. Now edit snappy config file mine is located in /app/config/packages/barryvdh/laravel-snappy/config.php # In some cases you will get permission denied
  13. If so you need to get the wkhtmltopdf.sh permission by writing: chmod +x filename.sh

Config.php file should look like this:

<?php

return array(

'pdf' => array(
    'enabled' => true,
    'binary' => '/usr/bin/wkhtmltopdf.sh',
    'options' => array(),
),
'image' => array(
    'enabled' => true,
    'binary' => '/usr/bin/wkhtmltoimage.sh',
    'options' => array(),
),

);

If you donโt have a config read this documentation: https://github.com/barryvdh/laravel-snappy/tree/0.1

This link helped me on the right track. Link: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9604625/wkhtmltopdf-cannot-connect-to-x-server

65. Reset SSD Ubuntu 15.04

cd /dev/ sudo hdparm -I sda

Then it will show some text, we are interested in this part, specically the part that says frozen:

" Security: Master password revision code = 65534 supported not enabled (this should be enabled) not locked frozen (this should be not frozen) not expired: security count supported: enhanced erase 4min for SECURITY ERASE UNIT. 2min for ENHANCED SECURITY ERASE UNIT. "

We want it to say not frozen and enabled

To do this write: systemctl suspend

The system will suspend and then start up again, when it does write "sudo hdparm -I sda" again.

Now it will say: not frozen

Now type to change enabled to not enabled: sudo hdparm --user-master u --security-set-pass A-pass-word sda

Then the cli will display: security_password="A-pass-word"

If you type sudo "hdparm -I sda" it should say:

enabled (instead of not enabled)

Final step, which will wipe the SSD which mean everything on the SSD will be lost, so backup if have something on that want.

Now type: hdparm --user-master u --security-erase A-pass-word sda

Links: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bMir8LOXX6U https://ata.wiki.kernel.org/index.php/ATASecureErase

63. Could not ssh into server

I had forgotten all my credentials to a remote server, which I really wanted to log in to. It was a digitalocean server so I could just login to my account and reset the password.

After this I tried to ssh in to the server in any possible way, but I just could not.

When I wrote ssh root@ip_address

I got "permission denied".

So I figured out problem which was that I tried to ssh in with root and by default login in with root is not permitted.

To test if this was the case I accessed to web console droplet and wrote: nano /etc/ssh/sshd_config

So in this file I changed "PermitRootLogin no" to "PermitRootLogin yes" and then:

sudo service ssh restart

After this I had not problem loggin in.

My guess is that there is a reason why root is not permitted login by default, so I changed it back "PermitRootLogin no" and figured out how to create another user.

Link: http://askubuntu.com/questions/497895/permission-denied-for-rootlocalhost-for-ssh-connection

59. Kill Node process

Usually when you want to quit a node server you press CTRL + C or CTRL + Z.

But if you want to stop the Node server where you have killed of the terminal that you used to start Node.

You get this error if you try to start node again:

Error: listen EADDRINUSE :::3000 at Object.exports.errnoException (util.js:837:11) at exports.exceptionWithHostPort (util.js:860:20) at Server.listen2 (net.js:1231:14) at listen (net.js:1267:10) at Server.listen (net.js:1363:5) at EventEmitter.listen (/root/my-site/nodemodules/express/lib/application.js:617:24) at Object. (/root/my-site/index.js:33:5) at Module.compile (module.js:434:26) at Object.Module.extensions..js (module.js:452:10) at Module.load (module.js:355:32)

You can fix this with:

Write: ps aux | grep node

Find the process ID, which second from the left (in my case 4 digits) it should look something like this:

root xxxx 0.0 xx xxxxxx xxxxx pts/0 Sl+ 09:18 0:00 node index.js root xxxx 0.0 xx xxxxx xxx pts/4 S+ 09:41 0:00 grep --color=au

Then write: kill -9 PROCESS_ID

For example: kill -9 4485

and then you are good to go.
